DataElement.preferredName: Best Computed Tomography Coordinate Midline Center Length Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the measurement of the length of midline to center of tumor of best coordinate used during a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Best Computed Tomography Coordinate Midline Center Length
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to length of midline to center of tumor of best coordinate used during a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having the most positive qualities.:A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :A number or other designation that identifies a position relative to an axis or grid.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
A number or other designation that identifies a position relative to an axis or grid.

Property.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.:Length; the linear extent in space from one end to the other.

Concepts.definition: A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
